description.para: Adapt the MCU clock frequency in Hz to your target.

detaileddescription.para: clock frequency in Hz, used to calculate delay timer

description.para: Use 0 for HD44780 controller, change to 1 for displays with KS0073 controller.

detaileddescription.para: Use 0 for HD44780 controller, 1 for KS0073 controller

description.para: Change these definitions to adapt setting to your display

detaileddescription.para: number of visible lines of the display
visibles characters per line of the display
internal line length of the display
DDRAM address of first char of line 1
DDRAM address of first char of line 2
DDRAM address of first char of line 3
DDRAM address of first char of line 4
0: no wrap, 1: wrap at end of visibile line
0: memory mapped mode, 1: IO port mode

description.para: Change LCD_PORT if you want to use a different port for the LCD pins.

The four LCD data lines and the three control lines RS, RW, E can be on the same port or on different ports. Change LCD_RS_PORT, LCD_RW_PORT, LCD_E_PORT if you want the control lines on different ports.

Normally the four data lines should be mapped to bit 0..3 on one port, but it is possible to connect these data lines in different order or even on different ports by adapting the LCD_DATAx_PORT and LCD_DATAx_PIN definitions.

detaileddescription.para: port for the LCD lines
port for 4bit data bit 0
port for 4bit data bit 1
port for 4bit data bit 2
port for 4bit data bit 3
pin for 4bit data bit 0
pin for 4bit data bit 1
pin for 4bit data bit 2
pin for 4bit data bit 3
port for RS line
pin for RS line
port for RW line
pin for RW line
port for Enable line
pin for Enable line

description.para: The constants define the various LCD controller instructions which can be passed to the function lcd_command(), see HD44780 data sheet for a complete description.

memberdef.name: LCD_ENTRY_DEC
memberdef.initializer: 0x04 /* display shift off, dec cursor move dir */

memberdef.name: LCD_ENTRY_DEC_SHIFT
memberdef.initializer: 0x05 /* display shift on, dec cursor move dir */

memberdef.name: LCD_ENTRY_INC_
memberdef.initializer: 0x06 /* display shift off, inc cursor move dir */

memberdef.name: LCD_ENTRY_INC_SHIFT
memberdef.initializer: 0x07 /* display shift on, inc cursor move dir */

memberdef.name: LCD_DISP_ON_BLINK
memberdef.initializer: 0x0D /* display on, cursor off, blink char */

memberdef.name: LCD_DISP_ON_CURSOR_BLINK
memberdef.initializer: 0x0F /* display on, cursor on, blink char */

briefdescription.para: Initialize display and select type of cursor.

parameterdescription.para: LCD_DISP_OFF display off LCD_DISP_ON display on, cursor off LCD_DISP_ON_CURSOR display on, cursor on LCD_DISP_ON_CURSOR_BLINK display on, cursor on flashing

briefdescription.para: Clear display and set cursor to home position.
Display character at current cursor position.
Display string from program memory without auto linefeed.

parameterdescription.para: string from program memory be be displayed
instruction to send to LCD controller, see HD44780 data sheet

briefdescription.para: Send data byte to LCD controller.

detaileddescription.para:
Similar to lcd_putc(), but without interpreting LF
data
byte to send to LCD controller, see HD44780 data sheet
none

briefdescription.para: macros for automatically storing string constant in program memory
Basic routines for interfacing a HD44780U-based text LCD display.

detaileddescription.para: Originally based on Volker Oth's LCD library, changed lcd_init(), added additional constants for lcd_command(), added 4-bit I/O mode, improved and optimized code.
Library can be operated in memory mapped mode (LCD_IO_MODE=0) or in 4-bit IO port mode (LCD_IO_MODE=1). 8-bit IO port mode not supported.
Memory mapped mode compatible with Kanda STK200, but supports also generation of R/W signal through A8 address line.

simplesect.para: The chapter Interfacing a HD44780 Based LCD to an AVR on my home page.
